{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Full Stack Software Developer",
  "description": "StrataHR is a talent sourcing consulting firm, recruiting the best talent for the professional services and technology industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Full Stack Software Developer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

Description


	We are looking for a talented and forward-thinking Full Stack Software Developer to join our team and help us build the next generation of LLM-powered web applications.
	This is not an entry-level role. We want an experienced mid-level developer who already understands how to build web applications the&nbsp;traditional way&nbsp;and is now eager to push boundaries by leveraging&nbsp;Large Language Models (LLMs)&nbsp;to accelerate development, improve user experience, and create entirely new product capabilities. The successful candidate can work remotely but will be required to be in the office atleast once a week.


Key Responsibilities


	Design, develop, and deploy web applications using modern frameworks (e.g., React, Next.js, Django, Node.js, etc.) and Large Language Models(e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic, or similar.
	Write clean, maintainable, and scalable code, balancing traditional software engineering with AI-enhanced workflows.
	Stay up to date with the latest advancements in LLMs, AI tooling, and web technologies.


Requirements


	Proven experience as a full-stack web developer, ability to build out web applications from start to finish using Large Language Models.
	Strong understanding of modern web development frameworks and APIs.
	Demonstrated ability to build and ship production-grade applications.
	Familiarity with integrating third-party APIs (payment gateways, auth systems, data services).
	Curiosity and enthusiasm for working with LLM platforms(OpenAI, Claude, Gemini, etc.).
	Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to innovate and experiment responsibly.
	Experience working directly with LLM APIs (e.g., prompt engineering, fine-tuning, embeddings).
	Must be able to self-regulate and meet development deadlines, typically 2 weeks
	Excellent speaking, listening and presentation skills.
	Manage a portfolio of web applications.
	Exposure to cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Azure).
	Knowledge of DevOps, CI/CD, and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
	Background in product design or UI/UX.
	Be a catalyst to deliver truly disruptive products that are growing rapidly
	Solve unique and first-order problems at a massive scale across web applications
	A working knowledge of WordPress is ideal but not mandatory.


Salary
N300,000 - N400,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and a Cover Letter to:&nbsp;hello@stratahr.ngusing &quot;Application for Full Stack Developer&quot; as the subject of the mail.

Note: Applicants must include verifiable portfolios and links to such portfolios.",

Full Stack Software Developer Job at StrataHR Limited




        
    

        
        StrataHR is a talent sourcing consulting firm, recruiting the best talent for the professional services and technology industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Full Stack Software Developer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

Description
     

            
    




	We are looking for a talented and forward-thinking Full Stack Software Developer to join our team and help us build the next generation of LLM-powered web applications.
	This is not an entry-level role. We want an experienced mid-level developer who already understands how to build web applications the traditional way and is now eager to push boundaries by leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) to accelerate development, improve user experience, and create entirely new product capabilities. The successful candidate can work remotely but will be required to be in the office atleast once a week.


Key Responsibilities


	Design, develop, and deploy web applications using modern frameworks (e.g., React, Next.js, Django, Node.js, etc.) and Large Language Models(e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic, or similar.
	Write clean, maintainable, and scalable code, balancing traditional software engineering with AI-enhanced workflows.
	Stay up to date with the latest advancements in LLMs, AI tooling, and web technologies.


Requirements


	Proven experience as a full-stack web developer, ability to build out web applications from start to finish using Large Language Models.
	Strong understanding of modern web development frameworks and APIs.
	Demonstrated ability to build and ship production-grade applications.
	Familiarity with integrating third-party APIs (payment gateways, auth systems, data services).
	Curiosity and enthusiasm for working with LLM platforms(OpenAI, Claude, Gemini, etc.).
	Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to innovate and experiment responsibly.
	Experience working directly with LLM APIs (e.g., prompt engineering, fine-tuning, embeddings).
	Must be able to self-regulate and meet development deadlines, typically 2 weeks
	Excellent speaking, listening and presentation skills.
	Manage a portfolio of web applications.
	Exposure to cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Azure).
	Knowledge of DevOps, CI/CD, and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
	Background in product design or UI/UX.
	Be a catalyst to deliver truly disruptive products that are growing rapidly
	Solve unique and first-order problems at a massive scale across web applications
	A working knowledge of WordPress is ideal but not mandatory.


Salary
N300,000 - N400,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and a Cover Letter to: hello@stratahr.ngusing "Application for Full Stack Developer" as the subject of the mail.

Note: Applicants must include verifiable portfolios and links to such portfolios.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "title": "Inventory Control Officer",
  "description": "Fidson Healthcare Plc, proudly Nigerian, is a leading pharmaceutical company which has evolved from being a distributor for multinationals in 1995 to full-fledged manufacturing, sales and marketing company with a strong brand. At Fidson, we support each other to greatness. We not only inspire our people to achieve, but we also celebrate their achievements with them. Together, we work and play hard.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Inventory Control Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Reports To:&nbsp;Factory Logistics Manager

Job Summary


	Are you a detail-oriented professional with a knack for numbers, systems, and seamless inventory flow?
	We&rsquo;re looking for an Inventory Control Officer to manage and optimize our finished goods inventory&mdash;ensuring accuracy, efficiency, and compliance across the board.


Responsibilities
What You&rsquo;ll Be Responsible For:


	Managing and tracking inventory to ensure accuracy and timely updates
	Analyzing inventory data to identify trends and recommend improvements
	Receiving finished goods from production into the store
	Posting stock transactions of finished goods in the ERP system
	Monitoring warehouse storage conditions and ensuring good housekeeping
	Supporting receipt and dispatch operations in collaboration with the Finished Goods Store Manager
	Resolving discrepancies in product receipts from production
	Preparing daily, weekly, and monthly inventory reports
	Ensuring accurate reporting of all packed finished products (Fidson and contract manufacturing)
	Participating in periodic stock counts and spot checks
	Contributing to the development and implementation of inventory control policies and procedures
	Performing other duties as assigned by the Finished Goods Store Manager or Factory Logistics Manager


Requirements
What You&rsquo;ll Bring:


	HND in Business Administration or any Natural Science discipline
	Minimum of 2 years of relevant experience in inventory or warehouse management
	Strong computer literacy and ERP proficiency
	Excellent communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills
	High attention to detail and accuracy
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively under pressure.


Note:&nbsp;If you&rsquo;re ready to bring precision and insight to our inventory operations, we&rsquo;d love to hear from you.",

Inventory Control Officer Job at Fidson Healthcare Plc




        
    

        
        Fidson Healthcare Plc, proudly Nigerian, is a leading pharmaceutical company which has evolved from being a distributor for multinationals in 1995 to full-fledged manufacturing, sales and marketing company with a strong brand. At Fidson, we support each other to greatness. We not only inspire our people to achieve, but we also celebrate their achievements with them. Together, we work and play hard.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Control Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Reports To: Factory Logistics Manager

Job Summary
     

            
    




	Are you a detail-oriented professional with a knack for numbers, systems, and seamless inventory flow?
	We’re looking for an Inventory Control Officer to manage and optimize our finished goods inventory—ensuring accuracy, efficiency, and compliance across the board.


Responsibilities
What You’ll Be Responsible For:


	Managing and tracking inventory to ensure accuracy and timely updates
	Analyzing inventory data to identify trends and recommend improvements
	Receiving finished goods from production into the store
	Posting stock transactions of finished goods in the ERP system
	Monitoring warehouse storage conditions and ensuring good housekeeping
	Supporting receipt and dispatch operations in collaboration with the Finished Goods Store Manager
	Resolving discrepancies in product receipts from production
	Preparing daily, weekly, and monthly inventory reports
	Ensuring accurate reporting of all packed finished products (Fidson and contract manufacturing)
	Participating in periodic stock counts and spot checks
	Contributing to the development and implementation of inventory control policies and procedures
	Performing other duties as assigned by the Finished Goods Store Manager or Factory Logistics Manager


Requirements
What You’ll Bring:


	HND in Business Administration or any Natural Science discipline
	Minimum of 2 years of relevant experience in inventory or warehouse management
	Strong computer literacy and ERP proficiency
	Excellent communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills
	High attention to detail and accuracy
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively under pressure.


Note: If you’re ready to bring precision and insight to our inventory operations, we’d love to hear from you.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Documentation Officer",
  "description": "Shalina Healthcare is one of the largest pharmaceutical companies in sub-Saharan Africa. For the last 35 years, we have made it our mission to provide quality medicines to those who need it the most. We manufacture and distribute branded prescription and over-the-counter pharmaceutical and consumer products across various therapeutic groups, including anti-malarial, antibiotics, anti-inflammatory, and nutrition. We have a track record few can match and our brands are among the most trusted in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Documentation Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria
Job Type: Full-time
Department: Quality

Job Summary


	We are looking for a Documentation Officer to join our QA team.
	The role involves preparing, issuing, reviewing, and controlling GMP-related documents, ensuring compliance with Good Documentation Practices (GDP), and supporting audits and inspections


Key Responsibilities


	Prepare, issue, and control SOPs, Batch Records, and other QA documents.
	Maintain document master lists, revision control, and secure archiving.
	Ensure compliance with cGMP, GDP, and regulatory requirements.
	Support audits/inspections and coordinate document retrieval.
	Train staff on documentation processes.


Requirements


	Industrial Chemistry, Microbiology, Biochemistry, Chemistry, or related field.
	3 -9 years of experience in QA/Documentation (Pharmaceutical or FMCG).
	Strong knowledge of GMP/GDP and quality management systems.
	Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and proficiency in MS Office.

Documentation Officer Job at Shalina Healthcare




        
    

        
        Shalina Healthcare is one of the largest pharmaceutical companies in sub-Saharan Africa. For the last 35 years, we have made it our mission to provide quality medicines to those who need it the most. We manufacture and distribute branded prescription and over-the-counter pharmaceutical and consumer products across various therapeutic groups, including anti-malarial, antibiotics, anti-inflammatory, and nutrition. We have a track record few can match and our brands are among the most trusted in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Documentation Officer

Job Location: Nigeria
Job Type: Full-time
Department: Quality

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are looking for a Documentation Officer to join our QA team.
	The role involves preparing, issuing, reviewing, and controlling GMP-related documents, ensuring compliance with Good Documentation Practices (GDP), and supporting audits and inspections


Key Responsibilities


	Prepare, issue, and control SOPs, Batch Records, and other QA documents.
	Maintain document master lists, revision control, and secure archiving.
	Ensure compliance with cGMP, GDP, and regulatory requirements.
	Support audits/inspections and coordinate document retrieval.
	Train staff on documentation processes.


Requirements


	Industrial Chemistry, Microbiology, Biochemistry, Chemistry, or related field.
	3 -9 years of experience in QA/Documentation (Pharmaceutical or FMCG).
	Strong knowledge of GMP/GDP and quality management systems.
	Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and proficiency in MS Office.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "General Manager, Buka",
  "description": "Prixair Group is a diversified Nigerian conglomerate founded in 2011 by entrepreneur Demola Banjo.Headquartered in Abuja, the group operates across multiple sectors, including real estate development and investment, property management, hotel operations, catering services, media services, and bottled water production.

Prixair Group, our vision is to be a leading conglomerate that delivers exceptional products and services across various industries, contributing significantly to Nigeria&rsquo;s economic growth and setting benchmarks for excellence and innovation..

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager, Buka
Job Location:&nbsp;Wuse Zone 6, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The General Manager for Prixair Group Buka (Restaurants) will oversee and manage all Buka outlets across the city.
	The GM will be responsible for achieving financial targets, standardizing operations, enforcing recipe and quality consistency, and driving strategic sales initiatives to ensure profitability and brand growth.
	This role requires a commercially driven leader with strong operational expertise in the food and hospitality industry.


Key Responsibilities
Financial &amp; Business Management:


	Deliver and surpass revenue and profitability targets for all Buka branches.
	Monitor financial performance across outlets, analyze trends, and implement corrective measures.
	Develop and execute cost-control strategies to maximize profit margins.
	Prepare and manage budgets, forecasts, and financial reports.


Operations &amp; Standardization:


	Ensure smooth operations across all Buka branches, with focus on efficiency, service quality, and hygiene.
	Develop and enforce standard recipes and menus to maintain consistency across outlets.
	Oversee food quality, portion control, and presentation to align with the Prixair brand.
	Implement Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and ensure strict compliance.
	Introduce innovative operational changes to improve customer experience and efficiency.


Sales &amp; Growth Strategy:


	Develop and implement sales and marketing strategies to increase patronage and market share.
	Introduce promotions, loyalty programs, and partnerships to drive sales growth.
	Identify new market opportunities and support expansion of Buka branches.
	Conduct competitor analysis and adjust business strategies accordingly.


People Leadership &amp; Development:


	Recruit, train, and mentor branch managers, chefs, and frontline staff.
	Establish a high-performance culture across outlets with accountability and teamwork.
	Design training programs to improve staff knowledge on recipes, service delivery, and food safety.
	Evaluate staff performance and implement career growth or corrective measures.


Customer &amp; Brand Management:


	Ensure excellent customer service standards and timely resolution of customer complaints.
	Monitor customer feedback and adjust offerings to meet demand.
	Build and maintain strong community and stakeholder relationships to grow brand visibility.
	Uphold the Prixair Buka brand as the go-to restaurant chain for quality, affordable meals in Abuja.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Achievement of financial targets for all branches.
	Consistency in recipes, taste, and service quality across outlets.
	Customer satisfaction and repeat patronage rates.
	Growth in sales and overall market share.
	Staff productivity, retention, and training outcomes.
	Successful roll-out of operational and strategic initiatives.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Hospitality Management, Food Science, or related field.
	Minimum of 8&ndash;10 years of&nbsp; experience in restaurant or food service management, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership role.
	Proven record of managing multiple outlets or branches.
	Strong financial acumen with experience in budgeting, cost control, and revenue growth.
	Expertise in menu development, recipe standardization, and food safety compliance.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.


Personal Attributes:


	Highly organized, detail-oriented, and innovative.
	Strong leadership and people management skills.
	Commercially minded and target-driven.
	Passionate about food quality, customer service, and operational excellence.
	Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, multi-branch environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter in a single PDF document to:&nbsp;hrprixairgroup@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-28",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-08",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",

  },

General Manager, Buka Job at Prixair Group




        
    

        
        Prixair Group is a diversified Nigerian conglomerate founded in 2011 by entrepreneur Demola Banjo.Headquartered in Abuja, the group operates across multiple sectors, including real estate development and investment, property management, hotel operations, catering services, media services, and bottled water production.

Prixair Group, our vision is to be a leading conglomerate that delivers exceptional products and services across various industries, contributing significantly to Nigeria’s economic growth and setting benchmarks for excellence and innovation..
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager, Buka
Job Location: Wuse Zone 6, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The General Manager for Prixair Group Buka (Restaurants) will oversee and manage all Buka outlets across the city.
	The GM will be responsible for achieving financial targets, standardizing operations, enforcing recipe and quality consistency, and driving strategic sales initiatives to ensure profitability and brand growth.
	This role requires a commercially driven leader with strong operational expertise in the food and hospitality industry.


Key Responsibilities
Financial & Business Management:


	Deliver and surpass revenue and profitability targets for all Buka branches.
	Monitor financial performance across outlets, analyze trends, and implement corrective measures.
	Develop and execute cost-control strategies to maximize profit margins.
	Prepare and manage budgets, forecasts, and financial reports.


Operations & Standardization:


	Ensure smooth operations across all Buka branches, with focus on efficiency, service quality, and hygiene.
	Develop and enforce standard recipes and menus to maintain consistency across outlets.
	Oversee food quality, portion control, and presentation to align with the Prixair brand.
	Implement Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and ensure strict compliance.
	Introduce innovative operational changes to improve customer experience and efficiency.


Sales & Growth Strategy:


	Develop and implement sales and marketing strategies to increase patronage and market share.
	Introduce promotions, loyalty programs, and partnerships to drive sales growth.
	Identify new market opportunities and support expansion of Buka branches.
	Conduct competitor analysis and adjust business strategies accordingly.


People Leadership & Development:


	Recruit, train, and mentor branch managers, chefs, and frontline staff.
	Establish a high-performance culture across outlets with accountability and teamwork.
	Design training programs to improve staff knowledge on recipes, service delivery, and food safety.
	Evaluate staff performance and implement career growth or corrective measures.


Customer & Brand Management:


	Ensure excellent customer service standards and timely resolution of customer complaints.
	Monitor customer feedback and adjust offerings to meet demand.
	Build and maintain strong community and stakeholder relationships to grow brand visibility.
	Uphold the Prixair Buka brand as the go-to restaurant chain for quality, affordable meals in Abuja.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Achievement of financial targets for all branches.
	Consistency in recipes, taste, and service quality across outlets.
	Customer satisfaction and repeat patronage rates.
	Growth in sales and overall market share.
	Staff productivity, retention, and training outcomes.
	Successful roll-out of operational and strategic initiatives.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Hospitality Management, Food Science, or related field.
	Minimum of 8–10 years of  experience in restaurant or food service management, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership role.
	Proven record of managing multiple outlets or branches.
	Strong financial acumen with experience in budgeting, cost control, and revenue growth.
	Expertise in menu development, recipe standardization, and food safety compliance.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.


Personal Attributes:


	Highly organized, detail-oriented, and innovative.
	Strong leadership and people management skills.
	Commercially minded and target-driven.
	Passionate about food quality, customer service, and operational excellence.
	Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, multi-branch environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter in a single PDF document to: hrprixairgroup@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Real Estate Sales Executive",
  "description": "Castel Resources Consultancy Limited unlocks your business&#39;s full potential with our comprehensive HR outsourcing services. Our expert team handles everything from recruitment and payroll processing to employee benefits administration and compliance, freeing you from administrative burdens and ensuring legal compliance. With advanced HR technology, strategic planning, and dedicated support for employee development and relations, we streamline your HR functions, allowing you to focus on your core business activities and drive growth. Partner with us to elevate your HR capabilities and achieve seamless, efficient operations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Real Estate Sales Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time
Reporting To:&nbsp;Sales Manager / Head of Real Estate

Job Summary


	The Real Estate Sales Executive is responsible for generating leads, closing property sales, and building strong relationships with clients to achieve revenue targets.
	The role involves promoting residential and commercial properties, conducting site visits, and providing professional advice to clients on market trends, property values, and investment opportunities.
	The executive will play a key role in enhancing customer satisfaction while contributing to the overall growth of the company.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and develop new business opportunities through networking, cold calling, and referrals.
	Promote and market available properties to prospective buyers and investors.
	Conduct property viewings, presentations, and negotiations with clients.
	Advise clients on market conditions, property values, and investment opportunities.
	Assist clients with legal, financial, and documentation processes related to property sales.
	Prepare and maintain accurate sales records, contracts, and reports.
	Achieve monthly and quarterly sales targets set by management.
	Build and maintain strong client relationships to encourage repeat business and referrals.
	Stay updated with real estate laws, market trends, and competitor activities.
	Collaborate with marketing and property management teams to execute sales strategies.


Qualifications and Skills


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree or Diploma in Business, Marketing, Real Estate, or related field.
	Proven experience (2&ndash;4 years) in real estate sales or property management.
	Strong sales, negotiation, and closing skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
	Good knowledge of local property market and regulations.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet sales targets.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and CRM tools; knowledge of digital marketing is an added advantage.
	Professional appearance and customer-focused mindset.


Key Competencies:


	Persuasion and negotiation skills.
	Goal orientation and self-motivation.
	Market awareness and adaptability.
	Strong networking and relationship management.
	Integrity and professionalism.


Work Environment:


	Office-based with frequent client meetings and property site visits.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;castelhrjobs@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Positoion as the subject of the&nbsp;email.",

Real Estate Sales Executive Job at Castel Resources Consultancy Limited




        
    

        
        Castel Resources Consultancy Limited unlocks your business's full potential with our comprehensive HR outsourcing services. Our expert team handles everything from recruitment and payroll processing to employee benefits administration and compliance, freeing you from administrative burdens and ensuring legal compliance. With advanced HR technology, strategic planning, and dedicated support for employee development and relations, we streamline your HR functions, allowing you to focus on your core business activities and drive growth. Partner with us to elevate your HR capabilities and achieve seamless, efficient operations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Real Estate Sales Executive
     

            
    



Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time
Reporting To: Sales Manager / Head of Real Estate

Job Summary


	The Real Estate Sales Executive is responsible for generating leads, closing property sales, and building strong relationships with clients to achieve revenue targets.
	The role involves promoting residential and commercial properties, conducting site visits, and providing professional advice to clients on market trends, property values, and investment opportunities.
	The executive will play a key role in enhancing customer satisfaction while contributing to the overall growth of the company.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and develop new business opportunities through networking, cold calling, and referrals.
	Promote and market available properties to prospective buyers and investors.
	Conduct property viewings, presentations, and negotiations with clients.
	Advise clients on market conditions, property values, and investment opportunities.
	Assist clients with legal, financial, and documentation processes related to property sales.
	Prepare and maintain accurate sales records, contracts, and reports.
	Achieve monthly and quarterly sales targets set by management.
	Build and maintain strong client relationships to encourage repeat business and referrals.
	Stay updated with real estate laws, market trends, and competitor activities.
	Collaborate with marketing and property management teams to execute sales strategies.


Qualifications and Skills


	Bachelor’s Degree or Diploma in Business, Marketing, Real Estate, or related field.
	Proven experience (2–4 years) in real estate sales or property management.
	Strong sales, negotiation, and closing skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
	Good knowledge of local property market and regulations.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet sales targets.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and CRM tools; knowledge of digital marketing is an added advantage.
	Professional appearance and customer-focused mindset.


Key Competencies:


	Persuasion and negotiation skills.
	Goal orientation and self-motivation.
	Market awareness and adaptability.
	Strong networking and relationship management.
	Integrity and professionalism.


Work Environment:


	Office-based with frequent client meetings and property site visits.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: castelhrjobs@gmail.com using the Job Positoion as the subject of the email.
